misdeed: A series of grisly discoveries have left a village nestled in the foothills of a mountain range paralyzed with fear. Bodies, mangled and drained of blood, are found in the outskirts, each bearing strange, claw-like marks that seem almost human.
solution: The Vaesen is a Revenant and can be banished by finding its human remains, carrying them over a graveyard wall, and burying them in consecrated ground with a cross on the casket.

clues.description: The victims are all individuals who were known to have wronged others, their past sins coming back to haunt the village.
The attacks always occur during the darkest hour before dawn, leaving the village shrouded in fear as the sun rises.
Witnesses report seeing a shadowy figure with glowing red eyes standing over the victims, but it vanishes when approached.
A local historian uncovers a decades-old account of a man wrongly accused of murder, who swore vengeance on the village before his untimely death.
The temperature drops noticeably near the locations of the attacks, a chill that seeps into the bones and refuses to be dispelled by fire or sunlight.
The villagers discover a hidden message, scratched into the tombstone of the accused man, detailing his plan for revenge from beyond the grave.

plotTwist.description: The village elder, wracked with guilt over his role in the manâ€™s wrongful conviction, has unknowingly provided the Vaesen with sustenance, hoping to appease the vengeful spirit.
